Reverse 'Top Level' and 'Reserved Attributes' sections

To make it clearer that the 'Top Level' section refers to attributes at
the top level of a document while 'Reserved Attributes' refers to
attributes of objects inside of a resource array.

Added support for ArcaBook and Arca Trades (both multicast)
Added OPRA feed handler to community edition
added spec file for building direct edge RPMS
added a working sample direct edge plugin
working direct edge feed handler added to the repository
fixed a tiny bug whereby message loss count was not being properly reported when gaps expired

[Fixed #4535590] Added logging to properly capture in-order to out-of-order transitions. Also added improved logging when gaps are expired (and messages are lost) to make sure impact of gaps can be determined by analysing log files. [RN Added logging statements to make it easier to determine the impact of gaps in the feed]
A few very small tweaks to ITCH spec file as well as addition of a BATS spec file for building BATS RPM
Fixed a bunch of files that were still not licensed correctly
Added support for BATS Multicast PITCH (specification version 1.1)
adjusted Makefile for no-longer-needed tools subdir
inital commit of itch feed handler (copy of open-sourced code from private repo)
Enabled pairing mechanism allowing users to restrict viewing to those we have been paired with.
Fixed issue where messages that users sent were not showing up in her sent folder.
Removing a starter rake task that was created but is not going to be needed.
Removed tinymce stylesheet from the mix as well.
Tweaks to message.js
Put all of the message javascript back *except* the TinyMCE bit.
Another test to see if we can lick this javascript asset problem.
Maybe TinyMCE is the problem?
Converted jselect plugin CSS to SCSS so it can take advantage of the asset pipeline
Experiment to try to determine where a javascript error is coming from.
Experiment to try to determine where a javascript error is coming from.
Experiment to try to determine where a javascript error is coming from.

Fixed a mismatch between where the stylesheet_link_tag was pointing and where the asset really was.
Fixed mistyped precompiled CSS file
Moving necessary (but not included) css file into the list that will be pre-compiled.
One more try at getting the MySQL gem properly bundled
Whoops, forgot to bundle before committing.
Tweak to the Gemfile to get MySQL support installed.
Removed database.yml from the repo.
A few last minute tweaks.
Further fixes for small issues introduced by the Rails upgrade.
Some more tweaks to make the application more 'modern'
Mostly working with Rails 3.1, asset pipeline, etc.
Removing new_rails_defaults initializer since we are now using Rails 3
New version of db/seeds.rb looks fine.
Copied over javascripts (other than jQuery which is no longer required)
A little more boilerplate code.
Added updated error pages.

Moved images over.
Moving over tinymce into app/assets/javascripts/libs

Updated robots.txt file
Cleaning up the script directory
Removing vendored gems.
ajaxify switching folders in the message interface
added (X) after messages tab to denote number of new messages
messages now display differently when they are new
much improved message index interface
remove all remnants of receipt based message system
corrected a redirection on bad message url issue and added more detail to deletion failure notification
restored message deletion capability
fixed mailbox url in the 'you have a new message' notification email
refactored messages into mailboxes (so messages are not tied directly to each user)
added a mailbox resource
added yaml_db plugin for dumping data and moving it between environments
added validations to text field lengths (500 characters) and added some basic styling to error boxen
(hopefully) fix for bad emoticons
added emoticon support for message sending
much better reply code for messages -- now lists are possible
made item long description a text column to allow for longer values
added text and background color support for sending messages
integrated the TinyMCE editor in as the new message editor
added tinymce (but did not integrate it) and fixed some bought/returned redirection issues
better wrapping of reply text
fixed 1947897 -- not the most thorough fix but it will work and stop recipients from disappearing now
feature 1907155 -- added ability to see sent messages
bug 1923915 -- email is now sent to a buyer when an item is deleted (if there is a buyer) letting them know
a couple of additional tweaks to make the whole forward, back, history thing work really well
fixed tiny bug where the wrong item wasd initially selected when refreshing or going back
fixed bug where click on a link and then clicking 'back' would not display the correct wishlist
feature 1852942 - a user can reset her password
added ability to remove a recommendation (whoops) and fixed spelling of recommendation in the 'make a recommendation' link
feature 1851839 -- added ability for users to recommend items for each other
adding ability to actually view feedback through the GUI
ajaxified loading of other people's wishlists
feature 1893991 -- jquery plugin to replace boring dropdown with fancy html/css/javascript one that looks and works much better
prevent normal 'cancel' behavior on ajaxified forms and instead just close the colorbox
ajaxified a couple of forms (adding items, adding feedback)
fixed border around feedback button issue (and all other images that were links, though that was the only one so far)
one more small tweak to URL treatment (update an item with a url to one without works)
clarified labels on the new item form (short/long description instead of name/description)
updated feedback button art and fix for small URL http:// prepending code (not respecting blank URLs)
keeping only 10 releases (and deleting old stuff after each deploy)
setting max number of releases to keep (infinite is a little silly)
didn't like the grey text in the feedback button
tweaked feedback button
added application to 'exceptional' for exception notifications
adding feedback button PSD to repository for safe keeping
added feedback resource and permanent button for feedback on the left
tiny CSS fix for IE7 (which recognizes border-collapse as cellspacing...kinda)
a couple of tweaks to make it clearer that something is being marked as bought and/or has already been bought
a fix (hopefully) for the intermittent trouble editing a wishlist item
fixed line wrapping issue on messages
whoops...fixed a problem that i caused by changing and not checking something...stupid assumptions
converted a bunch of :include find options to :joins (for, hopefully better db performance)
feature 1851834 -- users can reply, reply to all, and delete messages from their inboxen
feature 1851834 -- first incremental commit on the way to full support for messages -- basic compose, index, send is implemented
feature 1851871 -- jquery code to remove the 'change' button and replace it with onchange behavior
initializers in shape.  migrations run to completion and an admin user is created when the server is started up.
added google analytics to the application template
removed migrations that are not really migrations (add some stuff to the database) and removed regeneration of authlogic gemspec from deployment
added new relic rpm to the application
removed .specification from the authlogic .gitignore so there is no more complaining
feature 1851826 -- display all items a user has purchased and allow the user to mark them as returned
fix for items with a url that does not start with xxxx://
small tweak to top right tabs -- they look better now since the hover style is consistent
DRYed and prettied up the top left tabs
fixed issues with add admin user migration that was preventing a fresh database from being created -- added some meat to the user show page
small fix on wishlist ordering
added ability for people to mark things as bought
new users get a default wishlist and an initializer to make sure all users have a default
added ability for users to see each other's wishlists
added basic wishlist functionality -- person's list is displayed on the home page and they can manage the list
visual fix for poorly centered forms
updated default action_mailer host for the production environment
whoops, didn't make the default admin user an admin
added default admin user (via migration) as a starting point for a new install
added working capistrano deployment
added password initialization via a token/email scheme and filled out the users controller to allow editing
small changes to the template (welcome message, log out link in the top right, change of colors) and tweaked authentication semantics
basic application layout to get started and working authentication system
removed default rails index.html, logo image, and update robots.txt to prevent indexing
some environment cleanup and setting of the correct time zone
frozen rails 2.3.4 and authlogic
initial commit

commit_list.message: Added a CNAME
First rev.
Added the -h flag to the tar command(s) generated by the copy strategy.  This brings the zip and tar handling of symlinks into alignment (and is probably what most people want anyway).
added 'the philadelphia story'
added Waiting for Godot

Revert "renaming all .htm files to .html"

This reverts commit 78107a0d39c21911d921a61e3b2c709112729baa.
renaming all .htm files to .html
trivial change (trying to kick the GH page tires
Adding CNAME file for github pages.
Adding archives HTML to the repo

[Fixed #13934137] Converted search for a place on the epi tab to a fields_for (from a form_for) to get rid of a bug in IE related to nested forms (which are, in fact, not in the standard and thus not valid HTML anyway).  In doing that added a hash of options to rendering of place checkboxes to allow the caller to override the default field name (so that the epi search checkboxes can behave just like they would with inside a form_for.
Changed PUT request (via jQuery) to POST with '_method=PUT' added to the request data.
[Completed #12272289] Added a very subtle drop shadow to the new logo (to help it stand out against the green of the header).  Replaced the footer image to match.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:csinitiative/trisano
[Completed #13002239] Converted permissions check to the new style (User#can?)
[Fixed #12967887] Added just the help text back in (even though follow up, etc. won't be included on the demo tab).

Added the private_cell helper (originally from Patient View) to the events helper module -- it is useful for displaying event data that should be replaced with some value when the event is not accessible to the current user.
Added some jQuery ajax loading code for pagination links on sortable tables
Added support for tables that are sorted by refreshing the table via ajax
[#11546087] Added support for sorting alerted events on the dashboard (still needs an enhanced cuke though)
[Completed #10093763] Hopefully for the last time ;).  Edit, show, and print views are now all consistent re: display of before and afta questions.
[Completed #11189633] site_config support for sendmail or smtp mailer options as well as deployment stuff to write the correct parameters for edge.

[Completed #10093763] Field on the demo tab is no longer a 'core field' in that it is not wrapped by core field calls and cannot have before/after questions associated with it.  Date first reported field on the reporting tab is not editable *but* all follow up and before/after questions are still displayed there.
[Completed #10876643] Added delayed job to project.
[#10876643 (EE)] Added delayed_job gem to the Gemfile and vendored the gem.
[Completed #10093763] Move date first reported to public health to the Demo tab.
Fixed failing enhanced feature for place event creation (while on the place event edit screen).
[Finished #6491885] (Again) -- Added a form submission handler that clicks the search button and cancels regular form submission
Added lib directory to watchr script and added -Ispec to the flags for the command to run specs (so require 'spec_helper' will work).
Added a watchr script that will run specs on change and associated specs when files in the app directory change
[Completed #6491885] Creating a new place exposure while editing an existing place event now allows you to search for an existing place as a starting point.
[Completed #9674673] Added 2011 to all files with a CSF copyright notice (and fixed some that never got 2010)

[Finished #9570343] Added tests and in so doing found a bug (second column click wasn't reversing the sort).  You can now sort the people search results (though a round trip to the server is required -- no way to avoid that since people search is paginated).
Just making the action column of place search results not sortable (doesn't really matter since the content is all the same but the idea of sorting on the actions column is just kinda weird).
Added some steps and expaneded others to support some EE tests (but that will be useful for all tests)
just the functionality -- need tests

[Finished #9570289] Moved some javascript from EE to CE (just plumbing, no functionality) and used that JS to implement sorting of the treatments results.  Added a handful of enhanced feature steps to support checking for an arbitrary number of strings in order and clicking on a table header an arbitrary number of times."
Use zip compression rather than tar + gzip which will default to following symlinks rather than adding the actual symlink to the archive
minor tweaks to presentation of nodata CSS class and made wrap_if return an empty string if passed a nil value that is not to be wrapped
Added an option to event link generation to exclude the event type (link text would simply be the action i.e. 'Show' rather than 'Show CMR')
Added a #short_type method to events so that a version of the event type sans the word 'event' can be retrieved in a uniform way
a tiny little bit of refactoring to support new formatting of addresses on the demo tab of patient view
Tweaks to styles used for PV tables
style tweak to fully support table sorting using the tablesort jquery plugin
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:csinitiative/trisano
tweaked some presentation and style for jquery-sortable tables
refactoring jquery lazy tab loading code to accept a callback function to be executed once the tab has successfully loaded (to do things like make a table sortable)
added some styles to better support tables with more data than reasonably fits on a single screen (scrollable tables)

Added a couple of translation keys for refactored show/edit link code (outbreaks were using a different key name pattern and different text than other types of events) and fixed a small bug in refactored code (call to #link_to_action was not having the options hash passed through)
refactored show_and_edit_links helpers to be more flexible, DRY, and most importantly work for patient view (where the option must exist to always display the show link regardless of permissions)
Updated translations to change 'Pregnancy due date' to 'Expected delivery date' in a few places
Added a few more classes for patient view event display
Added a last_comma_first_middle method to Person to, you know, generate the person's name in 'Last, First Middle' format.
Very small tweaks to get links within jQuery tabs to render correctly
Added a convenience method for converting multi-line strings to HTML without extra formatting and added a more compact address format for use in view-only situations
A little light refactoring of telephone formatting to better support patient view
Refactored code to detect 'yes' values in Person#died? into the ExternalCode class
Added some wiring and tests to determine whether a particular person is dead or not dead (cannot confirm life but no disease events resulting in death)
Refactored rendering of person's name in the people search to a helper (so it can be turned into a link in a plugin)
undoing broken change to Gemfile.lock from commit 7897da
Interim commit for patient view, canonical demographic information -- refactored javascript into .js files in the patient view plugin and added some helpers to spit out repeated snippets of HTML
Typo - jQuery's $ should be mapped to $j rather than j$
Tweak prepare_plugins script to accept paths with the descriptor.yml file at the end of them as well as without

[Fixed #4910501] IE does not properly style elements added via JS when they are created with a certain class and then added to the DOM.  Modified code to 1) make the element, 2) add it to the page, and 3) give it the correct class.
[Interim #4934170] Javascript should all be working in IE but the styling of the type-ahead results is still not good (in IE -- fine in other browsers).
added hirb gem to the :development group for pretty console output
removed hirb from Gemfile until i can figure out how to not break the build
[Fixed #4934170] due dates on auto-generated tasks (when treatments are added/changed) are now set to 30.days after the treatment date (rather than 1.month).

fixed failing enhanced feature 'Scenario: Deleting a common test type referenced by a lab result' -- more than one common test type was ending up in the database during the test leading to inconsistent results.
added a patch to prevent RubyGems related deprecation warnings with Rails 2.3.4 and earlier
fixed install_required_gems_mri.sh script to work with a 0 argument rather than having to create an empty file named 0 in the distro/ directory.

[Fixed #13934137] Converted search for a place on the epi tab to a fields_for (from a form_for) to get rid of a bug in IE related to nested forms (which are, in fact, not in the standard and thus not valid HTML anyway).  In doing that added a hash of options to rendering of place checkboxes to allow the caller to override the default field name (so that the epi search checkboxes can behave just like they would with inside a form_for.
Changed PUT request (via jQuery) to POST with '_method=PUT' added to the request data.
[Completed #12272289] Added a very subtle drop shadow to the new logo (to help it stand out against the green of the header).  Replaced the footer image to match.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:csinitiative/trisano
[Completed #13002239] Converted permissions check to the new style (User#can?)
[Fixed #12967887] Added just the help text back in (even though follow up, etc. won't be included on the demo tab).

Added the private_cell helper (originally from Patient View) to the events helper module -- it is useful for displaying event data that should be replaced with some value when the event is not accessible to the current user.
Added some jQuery ajax loading code for pagination links on sortable tables
Added support for tables that are sorted by refreshing the table via ajax
[#11546087] Added support for sorting alerted events on the dashboard (still needs an enhanced cuke though)
[Completed #10093763] Hopefully for the last time ;).  Edit, show, and print views are now all consistent re: display of before and afta questions.
[Completed #11189633] site_config support for sendmail or smtp mailer options as well as deployment stuff to write the correct parameters for edge.

[Completed #10093763] Field on the demo tab is no longer a 'core field' in that it is not wrapped by core field calls and cannot have before/after questions associated with it.  Date first reported field on the reporting tab is not editable *but* all follow up and before/after questions are still displayed there.
[Completed #10876643] Added delayed job to project.
[#10876643 (EE)] Added delayed_job gem to the Gemfile and vendored the gem.
[Completed #10093763] Move date first reported to public health to the Demo tab.
Fixed failing enhanced feature for place event creation (while on the place event edit screen).
[Finished #6491885] (Again) -- Added a form submission handler that clicks the search button and cancels regular form submission
Added lib directory to watchr script and added -Ispec to the flags for the command to run specs (so require 'spec_helper' will work).
Added a watchr script that will run specs on change and associated specs when files in the app directory change
[Completed #6491885] Creating a new place exposure while editing an existing place event now allows you to search for an existing place as a starting point.
[Completed #9674673] Added 2011 to all files with a CSF copyright notice (and fixed some that never got 2010)

[Finished #9570343] Added tests and in so doing found a bug (second column click wasn't reversing the sort).  You can now sort the people search results (though a round trip to the server is required -- no way to avoid that since people search is paginated).
Just making the action column of place search results not sortable (doesn't really matter since the content is all the same but the idea of sorting on the actions column is just kinda weird).
Added some steps and expaneded others to support some EE tests (but that will be useful for all tests)
just the functionality -- need tests

Reverse 'Top Level' and 'Reserved Attributes' sections

To make it clearer that the 'Top Level' section refers to attributes at
the top level of a document while 'Reserved Attributes' refers to
attributes of objects inside of a resource array.
